meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of pantomime.
meanings.sent1: The actor's pantomimic performance was filled with exaggerated gestures.
meanings.sent2: Her pantomimic expressions perfectly captured the essence of the character.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the pantomimic dance of the clown.
meanings.sent4: His pantomimic movements painted a vivid picture of the story.
meanings.sent5: The silent, pantomimic play told a story without words.

meanings.definition: Resembling or imitating the actions of a pantomime.
meanings.sent1: The mime's pantomimic routine entertained the audience.
meanings.sent2: The pantomimic gestures of the robot were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent3: The cat's pantomimic attempt to catch the toy mouse was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her pantomimic imitation of a bird in flight was surprisingly realistic.
meanings.sent5: The children laughed at the pantomimic performance of the silly clown.

meanings.definition: Using gestures and movements without speech to communicate.
meanings.sent1: The pantomimic storyteller enchanted the audience with her movements.
meanings.sent2: The pantomimic dance expressed emotions without words.
meanings.sent3: The pantomimic charades game at the party was a hit.
meanings.sent4: His pantomimic gestures conveyed more than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The pantomimic performance left a lasting impression on the viewers.
